page.title: 08THE FERRY AT HAMPTON LOADE 1
page.content: The ferry goes backwards and forwards across the River Severn at Hampton Loade.It has been doing this for twenty years.There were other ferries before this one.The ferry was made of wood from one big larch tree from the Dudmaston Estate.The two ladies who work the ferry are Mrs.Evans and Mrs.James.These two sisters have worked on this ferry since it was built. When the river is at its highest the ferry has been known to float on top of the bank.It stays up there for two days then it goes down with the river.When the river goes down it leaves a lot of sand and mud on the bank and landing stages and makes a lot of work sweeping it off. The ferry goes across the river diagonally.It is helped across by three wires and a pulley.
